abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            though sustainability is uncertain, largely due to
            individual characteristics of each project component, which
            either depend on sufficient allocation of funds, or, on the
            assignment, and retention of qualified staff. Lessons
            address, the need for a realistic assessment of constraints
            in project design, recognizing those constraints which can
            be mitigated by project design, not assuming that
            improvements will definitely achieve the expected results in
            educational outcomes. This translated first, into the
            limited involvement in project design of line units, who
            were expected to implement the project, but who only
            demonstrated lack of project ownership, a circumstance
            aggravated by significant staff turnover. Second, project
            interventions designed early on, could have overcome
            structural constraints, working around them to achieve
            better results. However, this would have required the full
            involvement of line units at the project design stage, which
            would have required more time for project preparation, and
            would perhaps, have recognized that modest project
            objectives - narrowing the project scope - could have
            improved implementation results.
